intro: Stilpnopappus dentatus, commonly known as the toothed pappus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bract structures. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its drought-resistant features. Its leaves are often narrow and toothed, contributing to its common name. The showy yellow flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, playing a role in the local ecosystem.
